intro: Ouratea orisina, commonly known as the white mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive, long-lasting blooms.
